meanings.definition: Not periodic; lacking a regular pattern or rhythm.
meanings.sent1: The aperiodic rainfall made it difficult to predict when the storm would end.
meanings.sent2: Her aperiodic visits always brought a sense of spontaneity to our routine.
meanings.sent3: The aperiodic chirping of the birds outside sounded like a random melody.
meanings.sent4: His aperiodic work schedule mirrored the chaotic nature of his creative process.
meanings.sent5: The aperiodic flickering of the old street lamp cast eerie shadows on the sidewalk.

meanings.sent1: The aperiodic bus schedule often caused delays for commuters.
meanings.sent2: The aperiodic bursts of laughter from the audience disrupted the speaker's flow.
meanings.sent3: The aperiodic appearance of the elusive cat kept the neighborhood guessing.
meanings.sent4: Her aperiodic text messages always seemed to arrive at the most unexpected times.
meanings.sent5: The aperiodic flicker of the dying candle signaled the approaching darkness.
